newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-NatMutual says might use Axa brand.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-NatMutual says might use Axa brand.

text.p: Superannuation and insurance group National Mutual Holdings Ltd might consider incorporating the name of its French parent Axa SA into its own branding, managing director Geoff Tomlinson said on Tuesday.

"I think at some stage we will have to (consider it), because AXA is very much a world name, it's a world brand and there could be some benefits for us in actually incorporating the Axa name," Tomlinson told a news conference.
Tomlinson was speaking shortly after National Mutual announced a net profit for the year to September 30 of A$210.9 million, up from A$115.5 million a year ago.
Axa, an insurance giant which recently said it planned to takeover rival UAP to create the world's second largest insurer, paid A$1.1 billion for a 51 percent stake in National Mutual last year.
Tomlinson said the company was yet to formally consider using the Axa name in its promotional efforts.

"Obviously we have spent a lot of money over a number of years promoting our logo and we do know from our research that our name is very well known in the market place...that's something that you don't throw away," he said.
